website_summaries.verdict: Worth trying if you want an alternative to regular cat treats, especially if you like the idea of a broth you can mix with traditional cat kibble.
pros: Made of all-natural, "human-grade" ingredients that includes chondroitin and collagen for joint support
Entices finicky eaters with its rich, meaty scent
cons: Expensive – you only get 5 ounces for the price

customer_reviews.title: Honest quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding honest kitchen to my the fur babies for about four months now, not only are they healthy as little horses, but their coats are so sleek and shiny. I've also not noticed an odor from their litter box, to not have that with the cats is a great in and of itself. One of my kitties isn't as fond of the bone broth as the other two, but she's a picky eater. I also feed their regular dehydrated food as well. And my picky eater is the first in line to get her meals. I highly recommend this food to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: R. A. BlackTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Tasty treat with added benefits for your dogs
customer_reviews.text: Well, I don't like it, but my dogs do. Great broth for finicky eaters, or dogs that need the added benefit of a bone broth. One word of caution for you: if your dog has a sensitive stomach and MAY throw up... Turmeric stains are permanent on carpets... just warning you. Well worth the added benefits of the broth, and the dogs eat it up. You can make enough for two servings, just pop the remainder in the fridge until the next feeding. Easy to make, and your dogs will lick their bowls.
customer_reviews.author: The Cartoonist

customer_reviews.title: Relief from hot spots for my cat?
customer_reviews.text: I like that it contains Turmeric and thought I’d try it for the anti-inflammatory properties as in the past year she has started developing hot spots. My cat, like many of you can relate, is very picky. She would not touch it as a broth, but adding a little bit to her wet food, she ate it just fine. I sprinkle just a little on top since it’s meant to be diluted and then mix it in well. I can’t say if it’s making her better but it fasnt affected her digestive system and I have been seeing improvement in her hot spots. To me, it was worth the try and so far I’m not displeased.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Company does not return phone calls - won't purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Before using this bone broth I called the company - Honest Kitchen - with important questions I had before serving it to my senior kitties. They never returned my call. I left two messages and nobody ever took the time to call me back with answers. I now have a worthless canister of this product and will never buy another "Honest Kitchen" product again.
customer_reviews.author: AK Vincent

customer_reviews.title: My pups LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product this week. I had tried making bone broth on my own, and still intend to do so every once in a while, but this was a great alternative to have when I travel. etc. I made two servings and keep it in the fridge. When it comes time to feed the frenchies, i just put their meal together and put a little bit of this on top - they LOVE IT. My frenchies eat a raw diet and this is a great supplement for them in addition to their regular meal. Overall a great purchase! Once it's in the bowl it lasts seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Gryszan

customer_reviews.title: Small miracles!!
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old black lab was having trouble even getting up. She was lethargic and barely walking, obviously in pain. We were beginning to think she wouldn’t be with us much longer. A friend recommended this bone broth, and it has changed our dog’s life! After a couple of weeks on this, she seems like her old happy self. She’s up and about, not struggling nearly as bad to get around. She’s playing with her dog toys again. The broth powder is easy to mix up. Keeps in the fridge for quite some time. I mix up a whole jar and measure out her daily portion, and pour it over her food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great food topper
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ingredients in this broth. All the ingredients are great supplements to any pets diet, in my opinion. Turmeric is a proven ingredient that can be very beneficial for cats and dogs. My pets enjoy their food so much more when this broth is prepared correctly and poured on top of their food. I stir this in every morning for their breakfast. I would definitely recommend this for pets that need some enticing to eat their regular food and for just the simple reason of the healthy ingredients inside.
customer_reviews.author: Kris3294

customer_reviews.title: Packaging needs improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Product did not come with lid to seal can after removing the foil seal. Have to place in another container. There was a large sticker across the back covering the how to make/serving suggestions. Upon slowly peeling the label off, the instructions also peeled off. Really wasn't necessary for the label at all. Haven't tried the product itself yet. Haven't got past the packaging. Hopefully the broth will be true to its description.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the happy tail wags alone!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has yet to meet an Honest Kitchen product he doesn't beg for, and I'm glad to buy it for him. He's a small 6 pound Pomeranian, so this jar will last for quite a long time. I don't strictly follow the mixing directions, just kind of eyeball it, and give my dog just enough to coat the bottom of his dog bowl. I love this especially as the weather gets colder, especially because he has lost most of his fur and is now quite bald, and I hope this warms him up a little. He loves this and drinks it happily every day.
customer_reviews.author: gnapye

customer_reviews.title: Cats wont go near this
customer_reviews.text: I am speaking for my cats when I give it one star for "I hate it". My cats wont have anything to do with this product. It should not be marketed for cats; only dogs. I would have liked it if my cats would drink this because it looks healthy.
customer_reviews.author: beck

customer_reviews.title: a great product with caveats
customer_reviews.text: Honest Kitchen makes great products for pets; I've used their bone broths with many sick puppies and senior dogs over the years. Just a reminder these contain turmeric; start your pet on these s-l-o-w-l-y, as some dogs don't process this spice well. If they vomit on carpet or area rugs, be prepared to see a permanent stain.
customer_reviews.author: timekeeper

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it and so do I.  Helps me with my digestive problems !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT PRODUCT. I even use it myself. It taste really good and helps me with my digestion and stomach problems. My little dog loves it too. I’ve bought over 7 canisters. I will continue to buy too. Love all the “Honest Kitchen” products. I’ve tried other brands but nothing can compete with Honest Kitchen !!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for our tripawd!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is a tripawd and his back hurts him oftentimes. However, since buying this bone broth, we have been able to notice a big difference in his back. He is running around faster, is much happier and hasn't seem to hurt as bad as he used to. I know that bone broth is so good for arthritis and joints in humans, and it seems that this is doing the same thing for our 9 year old tripawd. He loves it and we just mix it right in with his food twice a day! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie Storm

customer_reviews.title: my pup loves this!
customer_reviews.text: we feed our German Shepherd dry food in the morning and then raw food for dinner, raw food she devours right away - no problem there! but some mornings she wouldn't eat her dry food, guess its not as appetizing as the raw! so we bought this and have been putting a little on her dry food in the morning, 1. to help her want her breakfast (she now devours) 2. help her joints etc since bone broth is great for dogs joints, etc.. will order again!
customer_reviews.author: Neesa Scavone

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Yes to turmeric and bone broth and parsley. I cook my dogs' food and they get this three times a week for the quercetin boost and nutrients that bone broth provides them. They are older now and have tooth, bladder and joint issues (all from old age) and they need all these ingredients and love the taste.
customer_reviews.author: jflange

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog extremely sick
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if this product just didn’t work for my dog or what not but I’ve had her try this multiple times and it has sent her to the hospital each time. At first I assumed it was something she ingested because she just constantly threw up and had bloody stools. After being hospitalized, I decided to give this product another go a week later. Again, the same results. I’ve qlrwady contacted honest kitchen and I highly would not recommend this product to any dog owner
customer_reviews.author: Christine Meng

customer_reviews.title: A decent quick solution if I run out of homemade broth for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: We've tried the turkey and the beef broth. My dogs like it. It is a bit pricey, and when I've refrigerated left over broth I notice it does not gel any at all. That makes me wonder just how nutrient dense it is if it doesn't have enough collagen to gel even slightly. I mainly keep this on hand just for rehydrating their freeze dried raw patties when I run out of homemade bone broth for my dogs. I figure it's got to be better for my dogs than any grocery store bought broth with higher sodium.
customer_reviews.author: C Fritsche

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this bone broth! If it were a bit less expensive, I would buy it all the time. My very finicky indoor cats don't like it but my outdoor cats don't mind it over their food as long as I add only a little bit. I would give it five stars if it dissolved better without clumping up. That is the only complaint I have. For any other info on this item, please talk to my very happy dogs!
customer_reviews.author: cteama

customer_reviews.title: So far, nobody will eat it.  Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: My dog won't touhch the stuff. I make his own food and have made bone broth from scratch, which he devours. But neither he nor my cats want anything to do with this. Maybe it's all the tumeric? ... I'll keep trying. Also odd that it settles out rapidly. That's not a big deal because I can just shake it up again, but isn't bone broth usually gelatinous? This looks nothing like what I make from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: lia

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea of this but my 11 Husky is ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this but my 11 Husky is so picky and won't touch it. I baked some plain chicken in hopes she would like it as sort of a gravy/broth. She took a couple bites and wasn't interested. I really wanted her to like this with all the great reviews but to be fair my dog is really picky so if you're on the fence I'd still give this one a go because my sisters boxer who's also 11 loves this stuff and I swear it helps her arthritis/inflammation.
customer_reviews.author: sunkiss

customer_reviews.title: Makes dog vomit
customer_reviews.text: Dog didn't care much for it, unfortunately. When added to her kibble, she would sometimes eat it but it would also cause her to throw up. I'm guessing the turmeric could be a bit harsh for some dogs. I will look for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hari

customer_reviews.title: Not for puppies but good for senior dogs
customer_reviews.text: Gave our puppy diarrhea but our 8 year old dog benefits from it. My disappointment lies in the compound mixture since it it doesn’t mix well with becoming chunky. We’ve tried varying degrees of water temperatures but it doesn’t mix fully. This is better than the liquid mixture that is sold in my opinion though.
customer_reviews.author: b.blanksnen

customer_reviews.title: My German Shepherd Loves This!
customer_reviews.text: We started putting this on my dogs kibble at every meal and she LOVES it. She used to be a "grazer" but the trainer wanted us to get her to eat in a timely manner as it is better for her. We just sprinkle a little dry powder on top of her kibble and swirl to coat it and she is in heaven! The container seems really small for the price but a little goes a long way, it actually lasted us well over a month.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Not picky pup approved
customer_reviews.text: Three of my dogs enjoy the broth poured over their food, but unfortunately my picky eater simply won't do it. I have had success mixing the broth with his freeze dried toppers but the broth itself isn't enough to entice him to eat. I gave this product 4 stars because it is really easy to use and my non picky pups enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. If/when I have a dog that is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. If/when I have a dog that is not wanting to eat and/or whose illness makes eating regular food difficult THIS is the product I would utilize. Yes - I could "make" this on my own but working full time why would I? Cost vs time this product is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: fairwindschance

customer_reviews.title: Good for older dogs
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old pittie has had problems with back leg stiffness. Vet has not found anything so have been adding this to her food (HK Love and Force) and it seems to be making a difference. She really really like the taste, and it is filled with healthy ingredients, so all in all positive.
customer_reviews.author: click

customer_reviews.title: It's not that I don't like it, it's that my dog didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: It's not that I don't like it, it's that my dog didn't like it. Tried it a few times & she refused it, so I sent it to my daughter in FL. for her to try with her 2 dogs, haven't heard back yet if that was successful. But....maybe your dog will like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ralhicaj

customer_reviews.title: Too much parsley
customer_reviews.text: My cat who wants to eat everything doesn't like this. I bought it to help keep her hydrated and wasn't expecting it to have so much parsley. I have a feeling that's what she doesn't like about it. I plan to try and give it to her again sans parsley and will update my post if she try's any.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Human grade healthy bone broth for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Actually my dog loves this. I first purchased and now make for myself, bone broth, and thought, Why not get my dog some, too? Honest Kitchen makes human grade dehydrated bone broth for cats and dogs ... lasts much longer since it's dehydrated than the blocks I freeze and then defrost and prepare for myself. My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Liz Severino

customer_reviews.title: My cat gives this 2.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Quality ingredients, but my cat (who loves other Honest Kitchen meals) wanted nothing to do with the broth, even if mixed in with kibble. He at least gave it a try, but wasn't wowed. I think the tumeric is a little too strong for him, so deducting 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: cat9079

customer_reviews.title: 3 our of 4 dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: 3 of my dogs love this. My one with cancer turns her nose up at it. I have begun making them bone broth using chicken feet and a crock pot. They smell good cooking and they all love that. The smell is a bit spicy which is why I don’t think my one dog likes it. She isn’t crazy about golden milk I make either
customer_reviews.author: angelk9

customer_reviews.title: Helpped my dog!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with is stuff. I have been working with my vet for two years trying to get my dog to stop eating poop. We tried so many things, when I decided to see a different vet. She suggested to try bone broth, I have been feeding it to him for three weeks and he has not eaten anyone's poop since. He loves it! He sits by my side waiting for it to cool off. Some days I will put it on his food and others it's a mid day snack. He loves it every way. I think for the summer will freeze it to cool him off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This has been the best supplement for my foster dogs as well as my ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best supplement for my foster dogs as well as my own dog. After about 2 weeks on this, you can see such a difference in there overall health, skin and fur!!! I recommend it to everyone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Douglas

customer_reviews.title: he is almost like years have come off him
customer_reviews.text: My Dog is a whole New Dog! We have been using this for 5 months and his skin and attitude is so much different; he is almost like years have come off him; He is a whole new Puppy almost.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen L. Bieker

customer_reviews.title: Combination of added spices may be too much for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a difficult item to rate. I believe that it is perfectly fine product and probably does very well for most dogs. Unfortunately my dog got diarrhea the first day I put it on her dry kibble. To make certain it was the Beef Bone Broth I waited a week until her poops were normal. I added it to her morning dry kibble and diarrhea again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This was like magic!
customer_reviews.text: This was like magic!!!I have 7 Yorkies that are extremely spoiled and just getting them to eat ,the best,dog food is hard.I usually have to mix in something,usually meat of some kind.I buy the freeze dried Raw Food and add liquid.Used this BoneBroth and they all ate!So now I use this daily and will continue buying this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yorkiemom

customer_reviews.title: He likes it a lot
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves the taste, he drinks more water as a result. I decided to add it to his food instead, however his poop got a little looser. So, I give him a little less.
customer_reviews.author: Dj jeanty

customer_reviews.title: Great for my picky senior
customer_reviews.text: My picky pup loves this bone broth! I usually use some water to moisten her dry food (because she is a senior, with bad teeth), so now I use the broth instead and she finally finishes all her food and licks the bowl clean! Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Bear Grylls

customer_reviews.title: My dogs didn't like it.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately both of my dogs did not like this. I'm still trying to find something I can add to dry food so I don't have to give only wet food. It looks like it worked for a lot of other people, but not us.
customer_reviews.author: T. Clement

customer_reviews.title: Chicken broth is loaded with turmeric, so not all dogs will eat it.
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this bone broth would help my arthritic dog. It sounds so nourishing from the description. Unfortunately, the broth contains a ton of turmeric. My dog refused to eat it. Kind of a pricey experiment!
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: I have one dog that loves it, however it ...
customer_reviews.text: I have one dog that loves it, however it has a lot of spices and the smell seems to trigger seizures in my other. Had to give it away. For health, I think bone broth should be just that and not a bunch of flavors and additives. It is easier than making your own, but if you want the health attributes, I would ( and am ) making it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Presley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful supplement for my pups!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this supplement. Every mealtime I heat a Mason jar of water then add the Beef Bone Broth. Stirring makes all five dogs take notice. I add it to dry & canned food. From puppies to senior dogs, all relish the broth added to their normal food. I'm happy because of the added nutrition like turmeric.
customer_reviews.author: Madd Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Tasty for sure
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd and Golden Retriever loved it! I'm not sure if I could see any benefits though... Just finished our first jar, it runs out pretty quickly. Maybe will get another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: xelakitten

customer_reviews.title: I like the ingredients and the integrity of this company
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an add on liquid to use when making his food. I have also given this to my dog as a warm drink. It was a new experience for him and only had a little. He's extremely picky so it's taking some time for him to get used to his new meals. I like the ingredients and the integrity of this company.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I mix this up for all our ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I mix this up for all our pups meals when I haven't made fresh, but it's exceptionally nice for the dehydrated meals I make our pups for boarding & travel!
customer_reviews.author: J Wolfy62

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the taste, but gives them the poos
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love the taste, but it really gives them the runs. They don't normally go poo at night but both did and multiple times. It really cleans out the system. It has tremendous nutrients, but I had to stop giving it to my dogs. I felt like I gave them a laxative. It could be just their reaction but thought I would share just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Rcas

customer_reviews.title: Container was broken and content all spilled out
customer_reviews.text: I just received the item and the container was completed massed with the contents spilled out. I have to throw the whole thing away!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Furuta

customer_reviews.title: I mix this broth in my dogs dry food and ...
customer_reviews.text: I mix this broth in my dogs dry food and she eats every piece I also use the powdered broth instead of water in most of my cooking a bit expensive but well worth the money and I only use a tsp,per cup of filtered water,could not find anything unhealthy in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: My girl loves this broth
customer_reviews.text: Great add for my dogs natural diet. I use this for my older girl and she loves it. She seems to be moving easier too. We use the Honest Kitchen dehydrated mix base and add this to the base. Yummy, yummy!
customer_reviews.author: River Runner13

customer_reviews.title: Turmeric. My dog is not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be helpful for my almost-15-year-old boxer mix, but he was not a fan. (I've since been told by one of his vets that dogs don't like turmeric. At least mine doesn't, cause I know he loves beef!) I like The Honest Kitchen a lot - we used their Preference freeze-dried food for a while - so I wish this would have worked.
customer_reviews.author: Donna-Do-Right

customer_reviews.title: Pets go Nuts over this!
customer_reviews.text: My Pets LOVE this! I am pouring it over my dogs kibble and mixing with my 18 year old cats food. I know it has a lot of nutritional value as well as anti-inflammatory, so the fact that they love flavor over their food is a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Janae

customer_reviews.title: My pooch wouldn’t eat it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a leg injury and her appetite was waning. She seemed disinterested in eating her food. I was hoping this would entice her to eat. However, wouldn’t touch her food when I added this bone broth to her food. I decided to make the bone broth myself and my dog’s appetite has returned and she is enjoying the homemade bone broth. It was super easy to make and much better than this powder formula.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: My dog hated this
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Honest Kitchen products, but my dog really hated the taste of this. If I mixed it with her food, she wouldn't eat it. Not sure if it was the turmeric or something else, but this ended up in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Doggie Delight!
customer_reviews.text: I put this over my Chihuahuas dry food. They absolutely love the stuff! Tails wag when ever I go to the kitchen. I make it 1 cup at a time and refrigerate it as I use just a little each meal! They seem to like to eat better and for one of my dogs it makes her food easier to chew.
customer_reviews.author: ChiMom20

customer_reviews.title: I actually froze some of it in little cubes for him to enjoy outside now that it's warm out
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it! It does have a peculiar odor (we've purchased it before and the beef just has a bit of an off-putting smell to it). My dog doesn't mind that at all. I actually froze some of it in little cubes for him to enjoy outside now that it's warm out!
customer_reviews.author: Barnbine

customer_reviews.title: Good product but...
customer_reviews.text: The product is great but the last order I received expired within two months of purchase. It’s a good product but we won’t use all of it before it expires. Kind of a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H. Foskey

customer_reviews.title: This was a great addition for our sick puppy that came home with ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition for our sick puppy that came home with kennel cough from boarding! He loved it on the regular food and I think it helped him get better faster than he would’ve without it.
customer_reviews.author: KRushing

customer_reviews.title: I feel good about giving my dogs turmeric
customer_reviews.text: I feel good about giving my dogs turmeric. It is beneficial for so many things including fighting/preventing cancer, just like with people.
customer_reviews.author: mcm_9090

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this and I use it a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and I use it a lot to rehydrate his raw food. I also pour it into silicone molds and freeze it for a treat. I also buy the goat milk in this brand as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Fowler

customer_reviews.title: use for putting on my dogs food,
customer_reviews.text: use for putting on my dogs food, he has cancer and wanted to make it more appealing plus the benefits of bone broth
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: Re-ordering soon. My Boxer pups love this in their homemade food. Great taste to them and added health benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy B

customer_reviews.title: love this. It is goof for them as well
customer_reviews.text: Cats, dogs, chickens stealing the cats' food, love this. It is goof for them as well. I put this on an auto delivery plan.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Not for every dog
customer_reviews.text: Pup seemed to love the taste after trying a very small amount for her to lick but she had an extremely loose stool after. I inquired but no response so I take off three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Easy to prepare
customer_reviews.text: I needed a way to get my senior dog to eat a little more and this product has helped. It is easy to prepare and has a lot of added nutrients and beneficial herbs. The cat enjoys it too.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: My dog wouldn't go near it
customer_reviews.text: For all the ballyhoo about bone broth and the supposed benefits, my dog wouldn't even get near it. Speaks volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Arbini

customer_reviews.title: This is great for using to mix with kibble when you have ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great for using to mix with kibble when you have to feed dry. My dogs love it. All of Honest Kitchens products are high quality, human grade foiod for your dogs
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Cats did not like it
customer_reviews.text: It smelled nice to me, but my 2 adult cats just took a curious sniff and passed on it. I'll give it to a friend to see if their dog likes it.
customer_reviews.author: HiRub

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a can last a long time. I mix up a new batch every few days and keep it in a Tupperware in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: JamiePNW

customer_reviews.title: Mixed up the 1st batch today
customer_reviews.text: Have one finicky kitty n one that eats everything. I was surprised and dismayed that it wasn’t well received on the 1st introduction. I will however try a number more times. Fingers crossed
customer_reviews.author: TLK

customer_reviews.title: Great product for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly think this helped my dog with a brain tumor to have longer quality of life. Plus he LOVED the flavor. It helped him get the water he needed as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Bear Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good product, outrageous price increase
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for $9.79 back in January. Went to reorder...expected a price increase since the original purchase was a special buy, but I certainly didn't expect 350%. I will be looking for an alternative, and the same goes for all other Honest Kitchen products.
customer_reviews.author: Amy D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love this bone broth. I usually make my own but for travel or in an emergency this is amazing and super easy to give to the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Justmyopinion

customer_reviews.title: He likes it
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this stuff. I used to make bone broth but the house would stink and it took a long time. I'm happy to have the benefits without the other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: H. CrockerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Got this to help with hydration since my pup doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help with hydration since my pup doesn't drink enough water for her lil 2 lb self she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: PetNa

customer_reviews.title: I really like this for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: I really like this for our dogs. It's great to give to them on rainy days. One of ours just drinks it, the other one has to have some food put in it and mixed in.
customer_reviews.author: QuinnD

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to make and my dogs love the taste. Is great to soak kibble in to up the moisture content. Way easier than trying to make your own (and less stinky too). I also love that I can actually pronounce every single ingredient. No chemicals what so ever. Love this stuff!!

customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much my dog loves this stuff mixed with his dry food and a little water. Wolfs it down every time.

customer_reviews.title: Old Picky Pugs
customer_reviews.text: Our two old picky pugs absolutely loved this! They r on a strict Rx diet but our vet said this would be good for their stomach issues and achy joints. Was worried that they would turn u their flat little noses away from this broth on their food but instead they licked their bowls clean and wanted more. So far so good.

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Bone Broth - Natural Human Grade Functional Liquid Treat for Dogs & Cats
product_meta.description:
ABOUT BEEF BONE BROTH: Our tasty instant Bone Broth can be mixed with warm water to make a nourishing, and irresistibly mouthwatering drink, that’s got a few health-promoting properties, too. We call it a treat with benefits. 

Great for both dogs and cats, it can be served as a satisfying drink between meals, poured on kibble for a little extra moisture or used to hydrate an Honest Kitchen meal, our bone broth is incredibly versatile. You might find it tempts a picky pet, or perks up one who’s been a bit down in the appetite department, too.

ABOUT THE HONEST KITCHEN: The Honest Kitchen started in Lucy Postin’s kitchen in 2002 when she started making her dog’s meals from scratch to help combat his ear infections. The physical difference from his new diet was spectacular but her kitchen was a mess.

Lucy then realized that dehydrating whole foods made mealtimes much simpler while maintaining the natural health benefits of the ingredients. From there, The Honest Kitchen was born - and her kitchen stayed much cleaner!

Today, The Honest Kitchen is on a mission to revolutionize the pet food industry through their obsession with product integrity and commitment to help as many pets as possible get on the road to good health through natural, wholesome proper food.
feature_bullets: INSTANT BEEF BONE BROTH: This functional broth is a balancing, aromatic fusion of cooling, comforting ingredients like pumpkin and tumeric, inspired by Ayurvedic Principles.
FOR CATS & DOGS: Just add water to create your own nourishing homemade bone broth - serve as a warming treat, pour over kibble or use to hydrate your Honest Kitchen.
HUMAN GRADE: The Honest Kitchen meets the rigorous FDA safety standards to use the label 'human grade', ensuring the highest quality cat and dog broths.
ALL NATURAL: This all natural recipe is made with no by-products, preservatives or GMO ingredients - each container makes 10 cups of healthy broth.
MADE IN THE USA: All ingredients are processed in the USA in a human grade food processing facility with nothing from China.
